info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 4:43PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Pitkin and northwestern Gunnison Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 442 PM MDT, meteorologists and satellite imagery were tracking a strong thunderstorm near Marble, or 29 miles south of Glenwood Springs, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Satellite. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Pitkin and northwestern Gunnison Counties, including the following locations... Ragged Mtn, Redstone and Snowmass Village. This includes the following highways... Colorado 82 near mile marker 16. Colorado 133 between mile markers 28 and 63. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
